description: A trusted technician is given rare clearance and confronted with the dual protocols—one for participatory power, one for restoration of the disappeared—while reflecting on recent stories of loss shared in the bar.
The restoration protocol is executed, returning thousands of erased citizens to all systems and records, reuniting families and drawing immediate public attention to city abuses.
Grassroots groups publicly gather to welcome returned residents, document their stories, and demand justice, forcing a reckoning over BCI’s legacy.
